bug.author: annahung31
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
I'm using spleeter-gpu for separating amount of songs, and I found that sometimes OOM occurs after processing some (like hundreds of) songs. I checked for two things:
The song is not to long. The one that waveform.shape[0]=18120690 can be processed, but OOM happens at the one with waveform.shape[0]=17620596
Mulitprocessing I set the self._pool.daemon = True in spleeter/separator.py after self._pool = Pool() But the error still occur.
<denchmark-h:h2>Step to reproduce</denchmark-h>
installing spleeter-gpu pip install spleeter-gpu apt-get update apt-get install ffmpeg apt-get install frei0r-plugins
Run the code:
<denchmark-code>separator = Separator('spleeter:4stems', MWF=True) for i in audio_descriptors: separator.separate_to_file(i, output_dir, synchronous=True) </denchmark-code>
Got the Error

comments.comment: Hi, What's the unit in your RAM number ? do you have 4Gb or 400 ? :)
Hi, details are here: total: 376G used: 111G free: 213G shared: 1.0G buff/cache: 51G available: 261G Thanks!

Sorry did not read the stack trace in full. It seems the memory that runs out is your GPU's in which case this is a duplicate issue with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deezer/spleeter/issues/162>#162</denchmark-link>
Unfortunately memory at the GPU level is handled by tensorflow in a complex manner and we cannot provide much help on the matter.
